posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

It's time to post yet another Henchman build from the OC. This time it's Linu, who was a Sehanine Moonbow Cleric with low DEX, which is kind of cool. She went on to prove herself through Strength and determination, in a different way than most of her sisters. She did become a Champion of Sehanine, and she was quite gentle and charismatic, so Bard came in the mix too. Now at first glance, her build looks like one of those "born at 40" builds, but I assure you it's not. She can cast Magic Vestment on a Tower Shield and a Full Plate, drink a Cat's Grace potion, Cast Eagle's Splendor, cast Divine Shield (with some CHA gear this is excellent) and have a higher AC than any meleer. Now there are some unfortunate consequences to the way I built her, which was to take advantage of the CoT bonus feats as Great Wisdom increases as a way to help deal with the fact I needed to invest on 3 stats. So, in pre-epics, she will be a self-buffing meleer and summoner, but she won't be able to cast level 5 spells for a very long time, until she starts getting her Wisdom increases with CoT (yeah, Champion of Sehanine is CoT) feats. That is more of a nuisance than actually a problem, as all your main buffs: (Shield of Faith, Bull's Strength, Eagle's Splendor, Divine Favor, GMW, Darkfire, Magic Vestment and Divine Power) will be available to you and will progress accordingly. You just won't have useful spells like Word of Faith, Harm, Heal, Blade Barrier, etc.. Still, she will manage without, I can guarrantee that!

EDIT: forgot to mention XP Penalty from lvl 37 on.

So, here she is: Linu La'neral!

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Commented on this one first because Linu was the only hench I could ever make any time with, probably because her husband died and she was somewhat vulnerable at that time.

A minor point but I didn't know how close to RP value you intended the build to be...

Followers of Sehanine Moonbow prefer crescent-shaped weapons like the scimitar in NWN (falchion elsewhere). Naturally, it would require martial prof. stuffed in there somewhere, but like I said, didn't know how close to an actual representative character you were trying to design. The power of better crits would enhance it somewhat and standard clerics are renown for wielding crappy weapons.

I can't see where such a low Listen skill will do much good and would rather max UMD. Maybe some trap skills would be more useful since you will have a strong Divine trickery boost. Also, this seems much more a self-buffing melee build than a close range caster so I would swing all those Conc points over to Discipline. If the foe wants to taunt, let 'em... just before they die. With Gtr Sanctuary, you can always disengage and rebuff away from the fray if dispelled, which will be very tough anyway except for Mords.

I would also defy the "even final ability" rule by maxing WIS at 19 and take either Imp KD or Cleave, losing the added slot @level 1 & level 5, a DC (which is fairly pedestrian anyway) and a Will save (which is a small issue for a CoT). Yes, those suggestions together with electing martial for RP would mean you would be taking non-epic feats in epic but that never stopped me from making a more overall effective build, especially when building a feat-starved class like cleric. And the max Owl's buff will produce the identical WIS modification (@24 instead of 25) though it would lose the DC/save in a high-magic, capped ability environment. No big whoop IMO. Just a few thoughts to consider.

Pretty accurate perspective and build otherwise, Max.

She was built for WoG, and there you don't need more than 30 Ranks of UMD. As for listen, nearly all creatures use Hiding, even if they're not proficient with it, so with this Listen score you detect everyone but the rogue-types, Again, an evironmental thing, you can change it if you want.
I would also defy the "even final ability" rule by maxing WIS at 19 and take either Imp KD or Cleave, losing the added slot @level 1 & level 5, a DC (which is fairly pedestrian anyway) and a Will save (which is a small issue for a CoT). And the max Owl's buff will produce the identical WIS modification (@24 instead of 25) though it would lose the DC/save in a high-magic, capped ability environment. No big whoop IMO. Just a few thoughts to consider.
She wouldn't need to use Owl's from a point on, because on WoG you can cap Wisdom with items, but again, that is an environment thing, so it is also a viable tweak for other worlds.
Pretty accurate perspective and build otherwise, Max.
Thanks, glad you like her

Thanks for the input, I'm sure many players will find your suggestions very worthwhile to make her in servers other than WoG. Take care!
